sense.name: explanatory text
sense.commentary: COMMENTARY[+entity][+symbolic][+writing][+explanatory] Note: refers to written text that provides an explanation
sense.examples: He has written several published commentaries on the Old Testament. Sally skipped the editor's commentary in the preface and jumped right in to the novel.

sense.name: expressing an opinion, giving an account
sense.examples: We listened to commentary from a BBC correspondent on the radio. John's long-winded commentary of the project's goals put everyone to sleep at the meeting.

sense.name: serving as an illustration or explanation of something
sense.commentary: COMMENTARY[+relation][+role][+illustrative] Note: refers to anything that serves the role to illustrate a point
sense.examples: These starving refugee children are a sad commentary upon the state of the world. Mary's body piercings and gum-chewing are sufficient commentary on her lack of taste, according to Sally.
